trans-unit.source: Contains system colors, system brushes, and system resource keys that correspond to system display elements.

## XAML Text Usage You cannot declare this managed class in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], but you can use its static properties to assign values in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of the active window's border.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> with its <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush.Color*> set to the color of the active window's border. The returned brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> used to paint the active window's border.
Use the ActiveBorderBrushKey to create a dynamic reference to the active border system brush.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the brush is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.ActiveBorderBrush%2A>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> used to paint the active window's border.
This brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure that is the color of the active window's border.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The color of the active window's border.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the active window's border.
Use the ActiveBorderColorKey to create a dynamic reference to the active border system color.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the color is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.ActiveBorderColor%2A>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the active window's border.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of the background of the active window's title bar.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> with its <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush.Color*> set to the background color of the active window's title bar. The returned brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> used to paint the background of the active window's title bar.
Use the ActiveCaptionBrushKey to create a dynamic reference to the active caption system brush.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the brush is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.ActiveCaptionBrush%2A>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> used to paint the background of the active window's title bar.
This brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> structure that is the background color of the active window's title bar.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The background color of the active window's title bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the background <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the active window's title bar.
Use the ActiveCaptionColorKey to create a dynamic reference to the active caption system color.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the color is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.ActiveCaptionColor%2A>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the background <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the active window's title bar.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of the text in the active window's title bar.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> with its <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush.Color*> set to the background color of the color of the text in the active window's title bar. The returned brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that paints the text in the active window's title bar.
Use the ActiveCaptionTextBrushKey to create a dynamic reference to the active caption text system brush.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the brush is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.ActiveCaptionTextBrush%2A>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that paints the text in the active window's title bar.
This brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.

## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The color of the active window's title bar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the text in the active window's title bar.
Use the ActiveCaptionTextColorKey to create a dynamic reference to the active caption text system color.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the color is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.ActiveCaptionTextColor%2A>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the text in the active window's title bar.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of the application workspace.

## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the application workspace.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the face color of a three-dimensional display element.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> with its <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush.Color*> set to the face color of a three-dimensional display element. The returned brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that paints the face of a three-dimensional display element.
Use the ControlBrushKey to create a dynamic reference to the control system brush.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the brush is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.ControlBrush%2A>.

This brush's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, so it cannot be modified.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of text in a three-dimensional display element.

The color of text in a three-dimensional display element.

This dynamic reference will automatically update if the color is changed.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of the desktop.

The color of the desktop.

## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> of the desktop.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the right side color in the gradient of an active window's title bar.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The right side color in the gradient.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of the right side of the gradient of an active window's title bar.
Use the GradientActiveCaptionBrushKey to create a dynamic reference to the system brush that paints the color of the right side of the gradient of an active window's title bar.
This dynamic reference will automatically update if the brush is changed.
To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.GradientActiveCaptionBrush%2A>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ```
The resource key for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> that is the color of the right side of the gradient of an active window's title bar.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> for the right-side <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Color"></xref> in the gradient of an active window's title bar.

## XAML Attribute Usage ```

The right side color in the gradient.

To create a static reference that does not update automatically, use <xref:System.Windows.SystemColors.GradientInactiveCaptionBrush%2A>.
